reviewText: Very impressive!!! Brings for all of us a great moment of science and achievement of entire mankind.

I am very disappointed with the English subtitles of this film.  I thought the film itself was really good but it was very difficult to follow along as I am not a Russian speaker.  It looks like the English subtitles were generated with a computer translator and it made it a chore to follow the dialogue.  At times there were even typos.  As much as I am fascinated with the subject matter, I had to take a break in the middle because I was simply exhausted from reading the subtitles.  I think if you loved Apollo 13 and The Right Stuff then you will stick it out like me.  However, if you're not into space, then I can guarantee you will quickly loose interest because of the terrible subtitles.  This is not just a Russian accomplishment but an accomplishment for all humanity.  Even Gagarin's speech at the end is addressed to not only the Russian people but to all people of the earth.  I just wish the producers of this DVD would acknowledge that and put more care and energy for the English speakers of the world.
Excellent film about the first man in space.
